taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Heliantheae;subtribe Helianthinae;genus Helianthus;species praecox;

bio:treatment.discussion: The taxa of Helianthus praecox were placed as subspecies of H. debilis by C. B. Heiser (1956). They were separated later, primarily on the basis of crossing results (Heiser et al. 1969). The subspecies appear to form a grade between H. debilis and H. petiolaris.

key_statement.description: Stems procumbent to erect, branches horizontal, moderately hispid or hirsute; phyllary apices short-acuminate; paleae: middle teeth puberulent
Stems erect, branches ascending, moderately or densely hirsute or hispid-hirsute; phyllary apices short-attenuate; paleae: middle teeth white-villous (“bearded”).
Stems moderately hirsute; leaves (at least larger) 3–7.5(–8) cm; peduncles 20–30(–35) cm; rays 11–13
Stems densely hirsute or hispid-hirsute; leaves (larger) 8–9 cm; peduncles (25–)30–40 cm; rays usually 14–16
